meanings.sent1: The room became even untidier after the kids played in it.
meanings.sent2: Her desk was untidier than usual, with papers scattered everywhere.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's untidier nest made the other animals chuckle.
meanings.sent4: The garden looked untidier than a tornado had passed through.
meanings.sent5: The kitchen was so untidier that even the cat avoided it.

meanings.definition: Making something less tidy or neat.
meanings.sent1: She always managed to untidier her room within minutes of cleaning it.
meanings.sent2: The wind began to untidier the neatly arranged leaves on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to untidier the puzzle only made it more challenging.
meanings.sent4: The mischievous puppy untidiered the neatly stacked books on the shelf.
meanings.sent5: The rain untidiered the carefully raked sand in the zen garden.
